info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 2:47PM EDT until June 16 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following county, Watauga.
* WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 245 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain producing thunderstorms which prompted the advisory have moved out of the area. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area as water from the earlier heavy rain collects in streams and other low-lying areas. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Watauga River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blowing Rock... Moses Cone Memorial Park... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
